full_summary:
Government of Canada National Defence
=============================

**Procurement Title:** Low Bed Trailers
**Reference Number:** cb-947-34044960

**Procurement Overview**
------------------------

The Department of National Defence (DND) is seeking the supply of Low Bed Trailers and related items. The procurement is a request for proposal (RFP) against a Supply Arrangement (SA) E60HP-23LOWB.

**Bidder Eligibility**
---------------------

This RFP is open to suppliers holding a Supply Arrangement (SA) under the SA E60HP-23LOWB. Contractors who wish to become pre-qualified suppliers under this SA may refer to: https://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities/tender-notice/ws3756167237-doc3866688458

**Tender Requirements**
-----------------------

The DND requires eight (8) Low Bed Trailers and related items. The requested delivery date is within 120 days after receipt of order (ARO). The selected supplier must provide products in accordance with Supply Arrangement E60HP-23LOWB, Configuration 4, 7, 13, 14, 15, and 17.

**Procurement Method**
----------------------

This procurement will be conducted using a competitive process based on the lowest price.

**Trade Agreements**
-------------------

This procurement is subject to the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).

**Regions of Opportunity**
-------------------------

The procurement is open to suppliers world-wide.

**Contracting Entity**
------------------

ADM(Mat)/DGLEPM/DLP 5-3-4-1, 101 Colonel By Drive, Ottawa, Ontario, K1A 0K2.

**Point of Contact**
-------------------

Brian James, Contracting Officer
brian.james3@forces.gc.ca
(819) 939-3299

Closing Date: **2024-06-18T14:00:00**
Late submissions will not be accepted.

**Submission Guidelines**
-----------------------

Only suppliers holding a Supply Arrangement (SA) under the SA E60HP-23LOWB are eligible to submit bids. The bid submission deadline is mandatory.

Note to Bidders
---------------

Please submit your bids in English or French. The Crown retains the rights to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.

Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada.
The Crown will not pay for the preparation of bid submissions. Suppliers are responsible for the costs associated with submitting their bids.

---

Please point
